content: and work in stocki- work raglan increase round a every 2nd round 5 6 nette stitch for 1 then work decrease round 8 10 11 times total 26 28 32 36 39 stitches per every 12 9 9 7 6 6 6 7 5 4 3 rounds 3 4 4 5 sleeve 43 46 50 54 58 stitches each front and 6 6 6 5 7 8 10 times total back 138 148 164 180 194 stitches total decrease round k1 k2tog knit to 3 stitches from sizes 45 25 48 52 56 60 64 only end of round ssk k1 2 stitches decreased work raglan increase round a every 2nd round 10 8 6 4 0 0 times sizes 41 25 45 25 48 52 only k2tog knit to end next work raglan increase a every round 2 5 8 12 of round 17 19 times next work raglan increase round b every round 2 3 24 24 28 30 30 32 34 38 40 40 40 stitches 5 5 7 8 times total 41 43 45 50 52 56 stitches per sleeve 64 68 74 80 86 92 stitches each front and back 210 222 238 switch to smaller needle and work in 1 x 1 rib for 260 276 296 stitches total 5 using larger needle bind off loosely in pattern all sizes turtleneck work in stockinette stitch in the round without increas- using 16-20 smaller circular needle pick up 66 ing until yoke is 7 5 8 8 8 5 8 5 9 9 9 5 9 5 10 10 68 68 68 74 74 74 74 80 80 80 stitches along measured from back of neck note some sizes will be cast on edge place bor marker and join for at desired finished yoke length immediately after knitting in the round increases are complete work in 1 x 1 rib for 4 then switch to middle size separate sleeves from body keep bor marker and circular needle recommended size 7mm us remove all other markers as you come to them place 10 75 and continue in 1 x 1 rib for 5 more using 26 28 32 36 39 41 43 45 50 52 56 sleeve stitches larger needle bind off loosely in pattern on waste yarn using backwards loop method cast on 4 stitches for underarm knit 43 46 50 54 58 64 68 finishing 74 80 86 92 front stitches place next 26 28 32 36 weave in ends and block garment i recommend 39 41 43 45 50 52 56 sleeve stitches on waste wet blocking taking care to stretch out the yarn cast on 4 stitches for underarm knit remaining ribbing at the body of the sweater to match 43 46 50 54 58 64 68 74 80 86 92 back stitches sample shown - i designed this sweater to have crisp but open ribbing it s not meant to cinch at 94 100 108 116 124 136 144 156 168
